page.title: 11FRESHWATER BIOLOGICAL ASSOC.
page.content: organism's conditions and processesin freshwaters, some of which is contract. The association has two main laboratories, one is the Headquarters at Windermere, the other in Dorset. The FBA library at Windermere is probably the best freshwater biology library in the world. In 1977 a unit was set up in Teesdale to monitor different flow regimes on Salmon and Trout. The unit left in 1984 but a presence is maintained by staff at the NWA in Lartington. When Cow Green Reservoir was built a study of fish populations was made in the Tees and its tributaries. The Lartington staff made a study of water temperatures beacause of the use of upper Teesdale land. Lartington also provided electronic backup. Data is collected with water level recorders
